abstracts.cdata!:
The resettlement action plan (RAP) for
            the Road Sector Development Program Project in Ghana,
            reviews the land acquisition and compensation laws, which
            provides entitlement to compensation for affected property
            by public projects, as well as the possibility to seek
            redress through other avenues for people not satisfied with
            compensation. The RAP recommends the preparation of a social
            assessment, to include the demographic, and socioeconomic
            profile of affected populations, and an assessment of
            potential impacts on cultural, social and economic aspects,
            suggesting mitigation plans, and the application of a
            framework for compensation and resettlement as follows. The
            RAP stipulates institutional arrangements among the
            country's agencies and units, to align and identify the
            properties affected, followed by valuation of properties,
            presented at public forum, and in consultation with affected
            people. Monitoring, and assessment should follow, to adjust
            valuation as necessary, based on database information to
            control timing, and compensation issues. Authorization of
            payment will be made prior to resettlement and demolition,
            and, assistance will be provided to cover resettlement
            costs. Grievance mechanisms will be established to receive,
            and resolve possible complaints, and an independent
            evaluation of impacts will be coordinated.
